project.description:
Use this job if the application's state file is broken.
If the state file cannot be destroyed properly then manual clean up of resources will be needed.

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/bin/bash
aws sts assume-role --duration-seconds ${jenkins_provisioning_assume_role_duration} --role-arn "arn:aws:iam::${cnc_acct_id}:role/system/${jenkins_s3_role_name}" --role-session-name "teardown-rebuild" > assume-role-output.txt
export AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=`grep AccessKeyId assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"` export AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=`grep SecretAccessKey assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"` export AWS_SESSION_TOKEN=`grep SessionToken assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"`
aws s3 rm s3://$stack_s3_bucket/deployment_state_metadata/${target_stack}/terraform.tfstate
